JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in Kežmarok . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant used and reconstructed real property of which he was a co - owner .
On DATE CARDINAL other co - owners sued the applicant and several other persons , seeking their eviction from the property .
On DATE ORG in GPE , by an injunction , ordered the applicant to refrain from further reconstruction of the building . As a result , the applicant was obliged to live in a rented flat .
On DATE the plaintiffs withdrew the action . On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings on that ground . On DATE the applicant appealed .
On DATE ORG in Prešov upheld the first - instance judgment , which became final on DATE .

On DATE the applicant , represented by an advocate , lodged a complaint with ORG alleging that the proceedings before ORG had lasted an excessively long time . In particular , the applicant alleged that ORG had failed to examine the merits of the case for DATE , from DATE to CARDINAL DATE , and that the court had remained entirely inactive from DATE to DATE . The letter indicated that the plaintiffs had withdrawn their action on DATE and that at the time when the constitutional complaint was lodged the proceedings had been discontinued by a final decision .
The applicant enclosed with his complaint a copy of ORG decision of DATE . A stamp on the decision indicated that it had become final on DATE .

On DATE ORG rejected the complaint as out of time . ORG observed that under LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW DATE a complaint about delays in proceedings ( which were to be considered as “ notification of other interference ” for the purpose of that provision ) should be made within DATE when the plaintiff could have learned of the interference .

The decision further stated , with reference to LAW , that ORG was bound by the applicant 's submission , including his allegation that the proceedings had ended following the withdrawal of the action on DATE . ORG held that unjustified delays in the proceedings of which the applicant complained had ended DATE prior to the introduction of his complaint under LAW .

Under LAW ( CARDINAL ) , which applies to all types of proceedings before ORG , as a general rule the scope of ORG examination of a case is limited by the summary of the application for commencement of the proceedings , as formulated in a standardised and prescribed form by the plaintiff .
Specific rules applicable in respect of complaints under LAW are laid down in sections CARDINAL et seq .

Section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) provides that a constitutional complaint can be lodged within DATE from the date on which the decision in question has become final and binding or on which a measure has been notified or on which notice of other interference has been given . As regards measures and other interferences , the above period commences when the complainant could have become aware of them .

In many cases it has been the practice of all chambers of ORG to entertain complaints about excessive length of proceedings only where the proceedings complained of are pending before the authority liable for the alleged violation at the moment when such complaints are lodged ( see , for example , decision files nos . I. ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , II . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , III . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , III . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , PERSON . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , I. ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , PERSON . ÚS DATE and many others ) .

In his separate opinions in such cases CARDINAL judge of ORG consistently expressed the view that , in accordance with section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW DATE , a complaint about length of proceedings could be lodged within DATE of the date when the proceedings ended by a final decision ( see , for example , decision file nos . III . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , III . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , III . ÚS DATE , III . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL , III . ÚS CARDINAL/CARDINAL and III . ÚS QUANTITY ) . Reference was made , inter alia , to the ORG 's practice under LAW . The judge argued that the termination of domestic proceedings by a final decision was not an obstacle to the examination by ORG of their length where the relevant complaint had been made within the statutory time - limit .

In a reply to ORG inquiry in the context of the present application , on DATE the Vice - President of ORG indicated that it was the practice of chambers of ORG to examine complaints about delays in proceedings before ordinary courts only in cases where such proceedings were still pending .
